DOC.brief_summary: This study was designed to investigate the analgesic effect of bilateral superficial cervical plexus block in patients undergoing robot-assisted endoscopic thyroidectomy. The investigators hypothesized that bilateral superficial cervical plexus blockade would reduce the patient's pain score by more than 10 (on a VAS scale of 0~100) compared to a placebo group and control group.
DOC.brief_title: Analgesic Efficacy of Bilateral Superficial Cervical Plexus Block in Robot-assisted Endoscopic Thyroidectomy Using a Transaxillary Approach
DOC.criteria: ASA class 1 or 2 adult patients scheduled for robotassisted endoscopic thyroidectomy Patient refusal Bleeding diathesis Allergies to local anesthetics Patient unable to read consent form (Foreigner, illiterate) Pregnant women
